headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c †Mohammad Shahzad b Rashid Khan 78 (81b 8x4 0x6 150m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: MY GOODNESS! Goes for the reverse sweep and now goes to the pavilion! He tried to pick the line on about fourth stump with Rashid regularly bowling googlies, it's not the worst option as he'd be hitting with the spin. But the length is a touch too full for the shot. The result is he gloves it instead of getting any bat on it. Shahzad holds onto the deflection. Sri Lanka's set man is gone!

headshotImage.longCaption: Najibullah Zadran headshot

dismissalText.long: c Najibullah Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Dimuth Karunaratne c Najibullah Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 30 (45b 3x4 0x6 57m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Nabi does him in the flight! Karunaratne came down the pitch to one at 82 kph/51 mph. It dipped on him more than he expected and was playing for a bit of turn trying to drive over mid-off but it was the arm ball and the bat turns in his hand not timing it at all. The ball flutters toward Najibullah at long-on. He comes in 7 yards from the rope and takes the catch crouching down at shin height.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Nabi headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi headshot

headshotImage.caption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Dimuth Karunaratne, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: Nabi does him in the flight! Karunaratne came down the pitch to one at 82 kph/51 mph. headshotImage.caption: HDRL Thirimanne headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: HDRL Thirimanne headshot

dismissalComment.html: through him off the inside edge! Really slowed it up, pulled the length back, and Thirimanne, as he often is, was casual in trying to turn it somewhere towards mid wicket and ended up dragging it back on to his stumps

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: second time lucky for Nabi, who's having a gem of a day! Beautiful loop, drawing the batsman forward, but as though held on a string it drops just short of where Mendis could have smothered it, goes on with the arm and takes the outside edge straight to slip this time. Excellent captaincy to have the slip in

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: would you believe it, three in the over and Nabi is turning the match on its head! Another arm ball outside off, beautiful length as well creating the doubt in Mathews' mind as to come forward or go back, he does neither, hangs his bat out and the outside edge takes the Shahzad's gloves before being safely pouched by first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva c †Mohammad Shahzad b Hamid Hassan 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: That's another one and Afghanistan is scripting one of the great comebacks in World Cups! Great length does the trick again, goes to show how much was there in the surface had they got it right earlier, laden footed de Silva hangs his bat out and the ball just straightens off the seam and takes the outside edge that goes low to Shahzad but he hangs on

dismissalComment.html: quicker on off, pushed to cover and do we have a run-out here? Afghanistan are confident. This was always on the cards with the amount of indecision that had crept in and the replays confirm, Thisara is short of his ground despite the dive

dismissalText.commentary: Isuru Udana b Dawlat Zadran 10 (21b 0x4 1x6 22m) SR: 47.61

dismissalComment.html: What are you DOING UDANA?! 19 overs left to bat and Udana lifts his head for a wild slog over the River Taff. Full and straight on the stumps from Dawlat and the zing bails go flying as middle stump is knocked back. Dawlat runs through wagging his index finger to the skies. SL team management might be doing more than that once Udana walks through the changing room door.

dismissalText.commentary: Hazratullah Zazai c NLTC Perera b Pradeep 30 (25b 3x4 1x6 48m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: OH MY GOODNESS! 10 OUT OF 10 FROM THE FRENCH JUDGE FOR THISARA PERERA! Pradeep bounced Zazai, who hooked flat and hard toward long leg. Thisara had about 1.5 seconds to cover 15 yards haring to his left. The ball never got more than 10-15 yards above the ground but he judged it immaculately before diving forward to clasp on two inches above the turf. Spectacular, a momentum-shifting effort!

headshotImage.caption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Hashmatullah Shahidi player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! Sri Lanka have roared back into the contest and they're bossing this game. Extra bounce there for Pradeep as Hashmatullah tried to drive it off the backfoot and only managed a nick to the keeper. The square cut may have been a better choice there but a good old fashioned leave would have been ideal.

headshotImage.caption: Gulbadin Naib headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Gulbadin Naib headshot

dismissalComment.html: GONE! And goes for the review but this looked golden on the live shot! Full length ball pitching on off and angling into the pads. Najibullah was late with a flick across the line going a fraction onto the back foot. Ball-tracking stays on field with the ball shaving leg-stump on umpire's call!

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Castled! Pradeep did this to Scotland just a few weeks ago at the Grange and now he's bringing another match-winning spell to Cardiff! Good length ball jags back from outside off stump, Rashid was pinned on the crease not really coming forward or back. Tries to stab the bat down across the line belatedly and the ball brushes off his knee roll into the stumps.

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: The captain shows how it's done in the field! Full length on leg stump at 84 mph, Shahzad flicked it ever so slightly uppishly and Karunaratne at short midwicket lunges forward and clasps it at ankle height. 8/10 degree of difficulty but he made it look easy. A dent in Afghanistan's rapid start.

headshotImage.caption: Dawlat Zadran headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Dawlat Zadran headshot

dismissalComment.html: yorker and that's vintage Malinga! On middle stump and he had no chance with that as it crashes into middle stump

headshotImage.caption: Hamid Hassan headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Hamid Hassan headshot

dismissalComment.html: excellent comeback! malinga fires a yorker on middle, his loyal ally over the years and cleans him up to finish things off

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Mathews b Udana 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: great bowling by Udana is rewarded! Udana kept on teasing Rahmat with that fourth/fifth stump line on a consistently good length. After nearly dragging on earlier in the over playing away from his body, Rahmat is sucked into another play well away from his body and this time it clips the outside edge. It carries to Mathews at thigh height, as he crouches slightly to cushion the take in the breadbasket. Sri Lanka starting to claw back!

commentPostTextItems.html: 7.30pm Afghanistan go to Taunton from here, which has a reputation for being a high scoring venue. Sri Lanka go to Bristol, where they take on Pakistan. It's time for me to make the trek home as well, so on behalf of Peter Della Penna and Thilak Rama, it's goodbye. Thanks for joining, see you tomorrow.

Dimuth Karunaratne I think we had a good start after a long time and suddenly we lost a couple of wickets and we were on the backfoot. Bowling and fielding was the highlight. Wickets are the key, 187 is not easy to defend, we know their openers go hard, but once we got them they were on the backfoot and we kept getting wickets. Bowlers did a really good job, fielder did good job, but batting through the middle stage needs to improve

Gulbadin Naib Start of the day, the bowler's didn't bowl right areas, they scored too heavily in the first ten overs, but it was good how Nabi bowled but it wasn't a good start. Wicket was not easy for the batsmen and so we'd asked the bowlers to hit the deck hard and they came back well during the middle. We need some improvement in the batting, we need more partnerships.

Thisara Perera We all know because of the conditions, the ball does something when you bowl the right length. Fielding wise, I'm normally a good fielder, happy to take a crucial catch. We have an experienced attack, we thought we could defend the total

7.10pm As darkness descended over Sophia Gardens, there was light in the Sri Lankan camp as they scripted a remarkable comeback with the ball and won their first ever match in seven attempts at their bogey venue, Cardiff.

It hadn't started well as the Afghanistan openers got stuck in early but Nuwan Pradeep, inexplicably left out last match, produced a career best performance that included the scalps of the dangerous looking Zazai and Naib, when the Afghanistan captain and Najibullah Zadran were threatening to take the game away.

And when it mattered, it was over to Lasith Malinga, who rolled back the years with some vintage yorkers towards the end. It wasn't the perfect fielding performance either but when it mattered, Dimuth Karunaratne hit the stumps directly to send  Najibullah Zadran back and virtually seal the match then and there.

dismissalText.long: c Najibullah Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Dimuth Karunaratne c Najibullah Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 30 (45b 3x4 0x6 57m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: Nabi does him in the flight! Karunaratne came down the pitch to one at 82 kph/51 mph. It dipped on him more than he expected and was playing for a bit of turn trying to drive over mid-off but it was the arm ball and the bat turns in his hand not timing it at all. The ball flutters toward Najibullah at long-on. He comes in 7 yards from the rope and takes the catch crouching down at shin height.

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne b Mohammad Nabi 25 (34b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 73.52

dismissalComment.html: through him off the inside edge! Really slowed it up, pulled the length back, and Thirimanne, as he often is, was casual in trying to turn it somewhere towards mid wicket and ended up dragging it back on to his stumps

dismissalText.long: c Rahmat Shah b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c Rahmat Shah b Mohammad Nabi 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: second time lucky for Nabi, who's having a gem of a day! Beautiful loop, drawing the batsman forward, but as though held on a string it drops just short of where Mendis could have smothered it, goes on with the arm and takes the outside edge straight to slip this time. Excellent captaincy to have the slip in

dismissalText.long: c Rahmat Shah b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Rahmat Shah b Mohammad Nabi 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: would you believe it, three in the over and Nabi is turning the match on its head! Another arm ball outside off, beautiful length as well creating the doubt in Mathews' mind as to come forward or go back, he does neither, hangs his bat out and the outside edge takes the Shahzad's gloves before being safely pouched by first slip

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva c †Mohammad Shahzad b Hamid Hassan 0 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: That's another one and Afghanistan is scripting one of the great comebacks in World Cups! Great length does the trick again, goes to show how much was there in the surface had they got it right earlier, laden footed de Silva hangs his bat out and the ball just straightens off the seam and takes the outside edge that goes low to Shahzad but he hangs on

dismissalText.commentary: Isuru Udana b Dawlat Zadran 10 (21b 0x4 1x6 22m) SR: 47.61

dismissalComment.html: What are you DOING UDANA?! 19 overs left to bat and Udana lifts his head for a wild slog over the River Taff. Full and straight on the stumps from Dawlat and the zing bails go flying as middle stump is knocked back. Dawlat runs through wagging his index finger to the skies. SL team management might be doing more than that once Udana walks through the changing room door.

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c †Mohammad Shahzad b Rashid Khan 78 (81b 8x4 0x6 150m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: MY GOODNESS! Goes for the reverse sweep and now goes to the pavilion! He tried to pick the line on about fourth stump with Rashid regularly bowling googlies, it's not the worst option as he'd be hitting with the spin. But the length is a touch too full for the shot. The result is he gloves it instead of getting any bat on it. Shahzad holds onto the deflection. Sri Lanka's set man is gone!

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Karunaratne b Malinga 7 (12b 1x4 0x6 24m) SR: 58.33

dismissalComment.html: The captain shows how it's done in the field! Full length on leg stump at 84 mph, Shahzad flicked it ever so slightly uppishly and Karunaratne at short midwicket lunges forward and clasps it at ankle height. 8/10 degree of difficulty but he made it look easy. A dent in Afghanistan's rapid start.

dismissalText.commentary: Hazratullah Zazai c NLTC Perera b Pradeep 30 (25b 3x4 1x6 48m) SR: 120

dismissalComment.html: OH MY GOODNESS! 10 OUT OF 10 FROM THE FRENCH JUDGE FOR THISARA PERERA! Pradeep bounced Zazai, who hooked flat and hard toward long leg. Thisara had about 1.5 seconds to cover 15 yards haring to his left. The ball never got more than 10-15 yards above the ground but he judged it immaculately before diving forward to clasp on two inches above the turf. Spectacular, a momentum-shifting effort!

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Mathews b Udana 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: great bowling by Udana is rewarded! Udana kept on teasing Rahmat with that fourth/fifth stump line on a consistently good length. After nearly dragging on earlier in the over playing away from his body, Rahmat is sucked into another play well away from his body and this time it clips the outside edge. It carries to Mathews at thigh height, as he crouches slightly to cushion the take in the breadbasket. Sri Lanka starting to claw back!

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken! Sri Lanka have roared back into the contest and they're bossing this game. Extra bounce there for Pradeep as Hashmatullah tried to drive it off the backfoot and only managed a nick to the keeper. The square cut may have been a better choice there but a good old fashioned leave would have been ideal.

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan b Pradeep 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Castled! Pradeep did this to Scotland just a few weeks ago at the Grange and now he's bringing another match-winning spell to Cardiff! Good length ball jags back from outside off stump, Rashid was pinned on the crease not really coming forward or back. Tries to stab the bat down across the line belatedly and the ball brushes off his knee roll into the stumps.

The ball never got more than 10-15 yards above the ground but he judged it immaculately before diving forward to clasp on two inches above the turf. Spectacular, a momentum-shifting effort!

Extra bounce there for Pradeep as Hashmatullah tried to drive it off the backfoot and only managed a nick to the keeper. The square cut may have been a better choice there but a good old fashioned leave would have been ideal.

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan b Pradeep 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Castled! Pradeep did this to Scotland just a few weeks ago at the Grange and now he's bringing another match-winning spell to Cardiff! Good length ball jags back from outside off stump, Rashid was pinned on the crease not really coming forward or back. Tries to stab the bat down across the line belatedly and the ball brushes off his knee roll into the stumps.

seriesStandings.notes:
League Stage
In the event of teams finishing on equal points
* The team with the most wins in the League Stage will be placed in the higher position.
* If there are teams with equal points and equal wins in the League Stage then in such case the teams will be ordered according to their net run rate in the League Stage matches.
* If there are teams that are still equal, they will be ordered according to the result(s) of the head to head match(es) played between them (points, then if still equal, net run rate in those matches).
* If the above does not resolve the League Stage ordering and there are teams that are still equal, the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings.
* If all matches in the League Stage produce no results the teams will be ordered as per their League Stage seedings and the top 4 seeded teams will progress to Semi-Finals.
Semi Final
If a Semi-Final is tied, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team progresses to the Final.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, then the team which proceeds to the Final will be the team that finished in the higher position in the League Stage.
Final
In the event of a tied final, the teams shall compete in a Super Over to determine which team is the winner.
If following a tie, weather conditions prevent the Super Over from being completed, or if the match is abandoned or a no result at the end of the reserve day, the teams shall be declared joint winners.
